form.prompt: Key your examples containing degree words here:

radioGroup.prompt: Based on these examples, where do the degree words occur with respect to the quantifier?
radioGroup.codeInfo: Before is Spec-initial default and Spec-internal default.
radioGroup.radio: On either side of the quantifier
radioGroup.ruleInfo: Either is QP Option 4 (no matter what the answer is to next question).
radioGroup.codeInfo: Following is greyed out unless the either button is checked

radioGroup.prompt: Can all the degree words appear on either side of the quantifier?
radioGroup.radio: No, there are separate sets for each side

form.instruction: In the lexicon, mark this type of quantifier with the feature Q. This will change their category to Q for the syntax. If a particular quantifier can only go with plural nouns, add the feature plural to that entry. Also, mark any words which can modify them with the features Deg modifies_Q.For the No answer to either side: Those which can only occur before the quantifier also need to have the feature QP-initial and those which can only occur after the quantifier also need the feature QP-final. Do not enter either feature QP-initial or QP-final on any degree words which can occur on either side. end of For the No answer to either side:Note that these degree words will most likely not be the same as the ones which can modify an NP above.
